F1AFD880DFE40131591468A86D17958E.description: Many natural resources are limited. The amount available can be made to last longer by decreasing the use of some resources or by reusing or recycling certain materials.

comments: Enduring Understanding: Humans can alter the living and non-living factors within an ecosystem, thereby creating changes to the overall system.

F1AF3140DFE40131591268A86D17958E.description: All animals depend on plants. Some animals eat plants for food. Other animals eat animals that have eaten plants.

F1AEE2E0DFE40131591168A86D17958E.description: Energy Flow and Material Cycles in the Environment
comments: Enduring Understandings: Matter needed to sustain life is continually recycled among and between organisms and the environment. Energy from the Sun flows irreversibly through ecosystems and is conserved as organisms use and transform it.

F1AE91E0DFE40131591068A86D17958E.description: Plants and animals need enough space and resources to survive. Overcrowding leads to an increased need for resources.

F1AE49B0DFE40131590F68A86D17958E.description: An interconnectedness exists among the living and nonliving parts of an environment. This interconnectedness can be observed by the changes made by plants and animals in their environment.

comments: Enduring Understanding: Organisms and their environments are interconnected. Changes in one part of the system will affect other parts of the system.

F1AD67B0DFE40131590C68A86D17958E.description: People use the variety of plants and animals found throughout the world for food, clothing, and shelter (e.g., silk for clothing, wood for building shelters).

comments: Enduring Understanding: The development of technology has allowed us to apply our knowledge of genetics, reproduction, development and evolution to meet human needs and wants.

F1ACDBA0DFE40131590A68A86D17958E.description: Many different kinds of plants and animals live throughout the world. These plants and animals can be grouped according to the characteristics they share.

comments: Enduring Understanding: The diversity and changing of life forms over many generations is the result of natural selection, in which organisms with advantageous traits survive, reproduce, and pass those traits to offspring.

F1AC1DD0DFE40131590868A86D17958E.description: All plants and animals go through a life cycle of birth, growth, development, reproduction, and death. This cycle is predictable and describable, but differs from organism to organism.

F1ABCC90DFE40131590768A86D17958E.description: The offspring of some plants and animals do not resemble the parents. Similarities between parents and their offspring become more apparent as their life cycle continues (i.e., caterpillars become butterflies).

F1AB88F0DFE40131590668A86D17958E.description: The offspring of some plants and animals resemble the parents (i.e., a tree seedling resembles a mature tree).

comments: Enduring Understanding: Organisms reproduce, develop, have predictable life cycles, and pass on heritable traits to their offspring.

F1AB00E0DFE40131590468A86D17958E.description: Diversity and Continuity of Living Things

F1AABB00DFE40131590368A86D17958E.description: The ability of an organism to meet its needs for survival is dependent upon its environment. Manipulation of the environment can positively or negatively affect the well being of various organisms that live there.

F1AA6830DFE40131590268A86D17958E.description: Humans use devices and specialized equipment to ensure safety and to improve their quality of life (e.g., goggles, glasses, hearing aids, and wheelchairs).

F1AA13F0DFE40131590168A86D17958E.description: Technology expands the range of human senses.

comments: Enduring Understanding: Grades K-8: The life processes of organisms are affected by their interactions with each other and their environment, and may be altered by human manipulation. Grades 9-12: The health of humans and other organisms is affected by their interactions with each other and their environment, and may be altered by human manipulation.

F1A95960DFE4013158FF68A86D17958E.description: The brain receives signals from parts of the body via the senses. In response, the brain sends signals to parts of the body to influence reactions.

F1A91540DFE4013158FE68A86D17958E.description: Senses help humans and other organisms detect internal and external cues.

comments: Enduring Understanding: Organisms respond to internal and external cues, which allow them to survive.

F1A881D0DFE4013158FC68A86D17958E.description: In addition to basic needs for survival, living things have needs specific to the organism such as temperature range and food requirements.

F1A83F80DFE4013158FB68A86D17958E.description: Plants and animals are living things. All living things have basic needs for survival including air, water, food (nutrients), space, shelter, and light.

comments: Enduring Understanding: All organisms transfer matter and convert energy from one form to another. Both matter and energy are necessary to build and maintain structures within the organism.

F1A7B2C0DFE4013158F968A86D17958E.description: In animals the skeletal-muscular system provides structure, support and enables movement.

F1A76E30DFE4013158F868A86D17958E.description: Each plant or animal has different structures that serve different functions in growth, survival and reproduction.

F1A721E0DFE4013158F768A86D17958E.description: Plants and animals are similar to and different from each other in observable structures and behavior. These characteristics distinguish them from each other and from nonliving things.

comments: Enduring Understanding: Living systems, from the organismic to the cellular level, demonstrate the complementary nature of structure and function.

F1A61730DFE4013158F468A86D17958E.description: Weather can be observed, measured and described through the use of simple tools such as a thermometer, rain gauge and wind vane.

F1A5D640DFE4013158F368A86D17958E.description: Earth materials can be observed and described using simple tools (e.g., hand lens and balances).

comments: Enduring Understanding: Technology enables us to better understand Earth's systems. It also allows us to analyze the impact of human activities on Earth's systems and the impact of Earth's systems on human activity.

F1A53A60DFE4013158F168A86D17958E.description: Clouds are shaped by winds and are made of small water droplets or ice crystals. Cloud shapes can be used to help forecast weather.

F1A4F490DFE4013158F068A86D17958E.description: Water from rain, lakes, and underground, is needed by plants, animals and people for their everyday activities.

F1A4B150DFE4013158EF68A86D17958E.description: People who work or play outdoors often dress and base their activities on the speed of the wind and the temperature of the air.

F1A46D90DFE4013158EE68A86D17958E.description: Weather influences plants, animals and human activity.

comments: Enduring Understanding: Earth's components form systems. These systems continually interact at different rates of time, affecting the Earth locally and globally.

F1A3E0A0DFE4013158EC68A86D17958E.description: Rocks are natural combinations of minerals. Minerals can be classified according to their physical properties (i.e., luster, color and hardness).

F1A39830DFE4013158EB68A86D17958E.description: Soil type can be identified by testing for grain size and composition.

F1A345A0DFE4013158EA68A86D17958E.description: A soil's composition varies from environment to environment.

F1A30120DFE4013158E968A86D17958E.description: Sand, clay and humus have distinct physical properties and are components of soils.

F1A2BA20DFE4013158E868A86D17958E.description: Water can exist as a solid, liquid or gas and in different forms such as rain, snow and ice.

F1A26350DFE4013158E768A86D17958E.description: Components of Earth's system include minerals, rocks, soil, water and air. These materials can be observed, sorted and/or classified based on their physical properties.

comments: Enduring Understanding: Earth's systems can be broken down into individual components which have observable measurable properties.

F1A15920DFE4013158E468A86D17958E.description: Binoculars allow people to observe objects in the sky from Earth.

comments: Enduring Understandings: Grades K-5: Technology expands our knowledge of the Earth, Moon, and Sun System. Grades 6-8: Technology expands our knowledge of the Solar System. Grades 9-12: Technology expands our knowledge of the Universe.

F1A0C700DFE4013158E268A86D17958E.description: The appearance of the Moon changes in a cycle that takes about a month.

F1A084A0DFE4013158E168A86D17958E.description: The Moon can be observed sometimes at night and sometimes during the day.

F1A041A0DFE4013158E068A86D17958E.description: The pattern of day and night repeats every 24 hours. The Sun can only be seen in the daytime.

F19FF5F0DFE4013158DF68A86D17958E.description: The Sun and Moon appear to move slowly across the sky.

F19FA300DFE4013158DE68A86D17958E.description: From Earth many objects may be seen in the sky including the Sun, the Moon, stars, and man-made objects.

F19F59E0DFE4013158DD68A86D17958E.description: The shape of the Earth is similar to a sphere.

comments: Enduring Understanding: There are observable, predictable patterns of movement in the Sun, Earth, and Moon system that account for day/night.
Enduring Understanding for Grades 6-12: Observable, predictable patterns of movement in the Sun, Earth, Moon system occur because of gravitational interaction and energy from the Sun.

F19E89E0DFE4013158DA68A86D17958E.description: Moving air, moving water, and sunlight contain energy that can be put to our use.

comments: Enduring Understanding: People utilize a variety of resources to meet the basic and specific needs of life. Some of these resources cannot be replaced. Other resources can be replenished or exist in such vast quantities they are in no danger of becoming depleted. Often the energy stored in resources must be transformed into more useful forms and transported over great distances before it can be helpful to us.
F19E3DA0DFE4013158D968A86D17958E.description: The Production, Consumption and Application of Energy

F19DF1D0DFE4013158D868A86D17958E.description: When light hits an object, the light energy can become heat energy.

F19DAC50DFE4013158D768A86D17958E.description: Energy Interacting With Materials; the Transformation and Conservation of Energy
comments: Enduring Understanding: Energy readily transforms from one form to another, but these transformations are not always reversible. The details of these transformations depend upon the initial form of the energy and the properties of the materials involved. Energy may transfer into or out of a system and it may change forms, but the total energy cannot change.

F19D5D60DFE4013158D668A86D17958E.description: Transferring heat energy to an object will make it feel warmer by raising its temperature and it may cause a change in the object's physical properties.

F19D0BD0DFE4013158D568A86D17958E.description: Energy of a moving object can be transferred to other objects (i.e., the energy of moving water can be used to turn a waterwheel).

F19CBA70DFE4013158D468A86D17958E.description: When balanced forces act on an object it will remain at rest, but if unbalanced forces act on the object it will begin to move.

F19C6DE0DFE4013158D368A86D17958E.description: The position of an object gives its location relative to where you are (e.g., above, below, in front, or behind). The motion of an object describes how its position is changing. Pushing or pulling on an object can change its position or motion.

F19C1500DFE4013158D268A86D17958E.description: Forces and the Transfer of Energy
comments: Enduring Understanding: Changes take place because of the transfer of energy. Energy is transferred to matter through the action of forces. Different forces are responsible for the transfer of the different forms of energy.

F19BCDA0DFE4013158D168A86D17958E.description: Electrical energy is a form of energy that is used to operate many of our tools and appliances.

F19B7650DFE4013158D068A86D17958E.description: Heat energy is a form of energy that makes things warmer.

F19B0920DFE4013158CF68A86D17958E.description: Objects that move (i.e., moving air, moving water) have energy because of their motion.

F19ABE90DFE4013158CE68A86D17958E.description: The Sun is a source of energy that lights and warms the Earth.

F19A6CF0DFE4013158CD68A86D17958E.description: The Forms and Sources of Energy
comments: Enduring Understanding: Energy takes many forms. These forms can be grouped into types of energy that are associated with the motion of mass (kinetic energy), and types of energy associated with the position of mass and with energy fields (potential energy).

F199E5D0DFE4013158CB68A86D17958E.description: Technology has created new materials that can help people solve problems.

F199A040DFE4013158CA68A86D17958E.description: The properties of materials influence their use. Some materials are more suitable for making a particular product or device.

comments: Enduring Understanding: People develop new materials as a response to the needs of society and the pursuit of knowledge. This development may have risks and benefits to humans and the environment.

F1990C30DFE4013158C868A86D17958E.description: Physical properties of materials can be changed by exposure to water, heat, light, or by cutting, mixing, and grinding.

F198B700DFE4013158C768A86D17958E.description: Materials exist in one of three states – solid, liquid, or gas. Solids and liquids have easily observable properties and may change from one form to the other.

F1986E60DFE4013158C668A86D17958E.description: Materials can be described and classified according to the following physical properties: size, shape, mass, texture, color, and material composition. Students can observe materials' physical properties by using tools that include rulers, balances, thermometers and hand lenses.

comments: Enduring Understanding: The structures of materials determine their properties.

F1977540DFE4013158C368A86D17958E.description: Much has been learned about the natural world but there is still much to understand.

F1972E50DFE4013158C268A86D17958E.description: People from all parts of the world practice science and make many important scientific contributions.

comments: Enduring Understanding: Understanding past processes and contributions is essential in building scientific knowledge.

F1969E60DFE4013158C068A86D17958E.description: Tools are useful in science to help gather data for observations and measurements and provide a safe means of conducting an investigation.

F1965CB0DFE4013158BF68A86D17958E.description: People have invented new technologies to solve problems.

comments: Enduring Understanding: The development of technology and advancement in science influence and drive each other forward.

F195C490DFE4013158BD68A86D17958E.description: The use of mathematics, reading, writing, and technology are important in conducting scientific inquiries.

F1955E20DFE4013158BC68A86D17958E.description: The purpose of communicating with others is to share evidence and conclusions. Scientists communicate the results of their investigations to others.

F194FF60DFE4013158BB68A86D17958E.description: Scientists use observations from investigations and knowledge that is already known to develop an explanation.

F194B510DFE4013158BA68A86D17958E.description: The purpose of accurate observations and data collection is to provide evidence. Scientists use tools to enhance their senses in order to obtain more evidence.

F1946970DFE4013158B968A86D17958E.description: In a science investigation, a fair test is one in which all of the conditions are kept constant except the one condition being investigated.

F1941FD0DFE4013158B868A86D17958E.description: Scientific investigations, whether conducted by students or scientists, involve asking a question about the natural world.

F193D8F0DFE4013158B768A86D17958E.description: Understandings and Abilities of Scientific Inquiry
comments: Enduring Understanding: Scientific inquiry involves asking scientifically-oriented questions, collecting evidence, forming explanations, connecting explanations to scientific knowledge and theory, and communicating and justifying the explanation.

F1938AA0DFE4013158B668A86D17958E.description: Nature and Application of Science and Technology
